intro: Antherotoma angustifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leaf antherotoma, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Antherotomaceae and is characterized by its slender, elongated leaves that are typically less than 5 centimeters in width. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences, often with a slight reddish hue. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and specialized habitat, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
